title: Unified Data Modelling for Presenting Lexical Data: the Case of EKILEX

author: Arvi Tavast, Institute of the Estonian Language

segmentation: The recurring problem that is well known to everybody here is that there are many disconnected dictionaries that exist and something needs to be done with them.
And then what's wrong with them in our case is that we have about 140 different data set, both dictionaries and term basis.
Three separate systems used for writing them.
There are many different data models and data formats inside the dictionaries.
There are inconsistencies and data duplication and also the work of compiling those dictionaries is duplicated in many cases.
So what we do and what I plan to describe in this presentation is the economics project.
It's a new dictionary rating system and a major effort in importing existing data.
